turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hi, I need a coffee before that movie.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok, what do you want then?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: You know what I want.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Which Starbucks?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: It's the one on Divison and Hastings there in Spokane?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok I see it on the map. The Fred Meyer?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Sure that'll do.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: And just to be sure, you want what, exactly? A soy mocha lattee?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Poison your eyes! I'm an American!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: So an Americano?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Oh god no! A regular cup of coffee, being American is the base-level assumption, the pretentious twits.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok, so some Pike Place Roast?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Sure, whatever, as long as it has caffeine.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What size?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Medium.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: They don't have medium.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Oh god. Ok what's close to Medium?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Well they have a Tall, but you sound like you need a Grande.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Grande. You hear my eyes rolling out of my head? Ok, whatever.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok then I have a Grande Pike Place Roast, no cream or sugar because you like your coffee the way you like your women.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: That's right. Without cream and sugar.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Is there anything else? You will be there immediately?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Yep, I'm pulling in now. Thank you, bye.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Ok, it'll be ready and waiting, and you'll get a text receipt. Bye.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Bye.
